title: How to Cook Tilapia in the Oven

steps.title: Preheat your oven to 425 °F (218 °C).
steps.content: Preheat your oven to 425 °F (218 °C). Make sure one of the oven racks in the center position so your tilapia can cook evenly. Turn your oven on and let it preheat completely before putting your fish in to cook. [1] X Research source You can also use a toaster oven to make single portions if you want.

steps.title: Whisk together melted butter, garlic, lemon juice, and lemon zest in a bowl.
steps.content: Whisk together melted butter, garlic, lemon juice, and lemon zest in a bowl. Pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of melted butter and 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of lemon juice into a mixing bowl and stir them together. Mince 2 cloves of garlic with a chef’s knife and add it to the butter and lemon juice. Use a zester or a grater to scrape the zest off of 1 lemon, and mix it into your butter mixture. Mix the ingredients until they’re thoroughly combined. [2] X Research source You can adjust how many spices and herbs you put in the mixture to change the flavor. If you want to add a little spice to your tilapia, add ½ teaspoon (1.5 g) of red chili powder into the butter mixture. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Put your tilapia filets in an oiled cooking pan.
steps.content: Put your tilapia filets in an oiled cooking pan. Put a layer of non-stick cooking spray on a 13 in × 9 in (33 cm × 23 cm) baking pan so the tilapia doesn’t get stuck on the pan. Lay the filets down on the cooking pan so they have about 1 inch (2.5 cm) of space between them. [4] X Research source Thaw frozen tilapia completely before cooking with it, or else it may not get an even bake. Line your cooking pan with aluminum foil if you want an easy cleanup later.

steps.title: Drizzle the butter mixture over the filets to coat them.
steps.content: Drizzle the butter mixture over the filets to coat them. Slowly pour the butter mixture over the filets, letting any extra fill the bottom of the pan. Use a kitchen brush to spread the butter mixture evenly across the filets so they can absorb the most flavor while they’re cooking. [5] X Research source You can also top the tilapia with lemon slices if you want the filets to taste more citrusy.

steps.title: Put the tilapia in your oven for 10-12 minutes.
steps.content: Put the tilapia in your oven for 10-12 minutes. Set the baking pan on the center rack of your oven so the filets get an even cook. Leave the oven door closed while the fish cooks or else some of the heat will escape. Check your fish after 10 minutes to see if it’s white and flaky. Remove the tilapia from the oven once it’s finished. [7] X Research source Make sure your tilapia cooks until it has an internal temperature of 145 °F (63 °C). Otherwise, you may get sick from foodborne bacteria. [8] X Trustworthy Source Food Safety and Inspection Service of the USDA Food safety information provided by the U.S. Department of Agriculture. Go to source

steps.title: Serve the tilapia while it’s still hot.
steps.content: Serve the tilapia while it’s still hot. Immediately serve the tilapia after it comes out of your oven so you can enjoy it while it’s still warm. Eat your fish with sides of fresh vegetables to have a healthy meal. Squeeze a fresh lemon wedge over the fish if you want to add more citrus flavor to it. [9] X Research source You can store leftovers in your fridge for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 3 months. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Preheat your oven to 450 °F (232 °C).
steps.content: Preheat your oven to 450 °F (232 °C). Move the racks inside your oven so one of them is in the center position, or else your fish won’t cook as thoroughly. Turn your oven on to 450 °F (232 °C) and let it heat up completely before cooking. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Combine melted butter, garlic, lemon juice, and oregano in a bowl.
steps.content: Combine melted butter, garlic, lemon juice, and oregano in a bowl. Pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of melted butter and 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of lemon juice into a mixing bowl and stir it with a whisk. Chop 2 cloves of garlic with a chef’s knife into small pieces and add them to the butter mixture. Then put in 1 teaspoon (1 g) of either oregano or thyme and combine the mixture thoroughly. [12] X Research source You can use a mixture of oregano and thyme if you want to use both herbs.

steps.title: Put the tilapia filets on separate pieces of aluminum foil with asparagus.
steps.content: Put the tilapia filets on separate pieces of aluminum foil with asparagus. Rip off a large piece of aluminum foil for each filet you’re cooking. Set the filet in the center of the aluminum foil along with 3-4 sprigs of asparagus next to it. Bend the sides of the aluminum foil up to form walls. [13] X Research source You can also include slices of zucchini or broccoli in the aluminum foil if you want more vegetables. Make sure your tilapia is completely thawed if it was frozen.

steps.title: Pour the butter mixture over your filets and vegetables.
steps.content: Pour the butter mixture over your filets and vegetables. Carefully split the butter mixture between each of the filets and spread it with a kitchen brush. Make sure the tilapia and asparagus are completely coated in the butter mixture so the flavor can absorb into the meat. [14] X Research source Don’t bend the sides of the foil down or else the butter mixture will spill and won’t infuse with the fish.

steps.title: Wrap the foil around the fish so there’s a small opening on top.
steps.content: Wrap the foil around the fish so there’s a small opening on top. Bend the sides of the foil on top of the fish and asparagus so they’re completely covered. Leave a small opening in the foil on top so steam can vent out while the fish cooks. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Place the wrapped filets on the middle rack of your oven for 15-20 minutes.
steps.content: Place the wrapped filets on the middle rack of your oven for 15-20 minutes. Place the foil directly on the center oven rack or on a cooking pan so it can cook. Leave the fish alone inside of the oven for at least 15 minutes before checking if it’s done. Check if the meat is white and flaky, and use a meat thermometer to see if it has an internal temperature of 145 °F (63 °C). [16] X Research source The cooking time may vary depending on the size and thickness of your filets.

steps.title: Serve the fish with fresh lemon while it’s still hot.
steps.content: Serve the fish with fresh lemon while it’s still hot. Once the fish is finished cooking, put the foil wrap directly on a serving plate so you can open it just before you eat. Squeeze a fresh lemon wedge on top of the filet to add a fresh citrus flavor to your meal. [17] X Research source You can keep tilapia leftovers for 4 days in the fridge or up to 3 months in the freezer.

steps.title: Preheat your oven to broil.
steps.content: Preheat your oven to broil. The broil setting on your oven will make your fish taste like it’s been made on the grill. Turn your oven to broil and let it heat up completely before cooking. Make sure one of the cooking racks is in the middle position inside your oven. [18] X Research source Not every oven will have a broil setting.

steps.title: Combine mayonnaise, parsley, and lemon zest in a bowl.
steps.content: Combine mayonnaise, parsley, and lemon zest in a bowl. Pour 1 ⁄ 4 cup (59 ml) of mayonnaise and 2 tablespoons (7.5 g) of fresh parsley into a mixing bowl, and stir them together. Use a zester or fork to scrape the zest off of a fresh lemon until you have 1 teaspoon (2 g). Use a whisk to thoroughly combine the herbs with the mayonnaise. [19] X Research source You can also add 2 cloves of minced garlic to infuse your fish with more aromatic flavors.

steps.title: Put your tilapia on a lined baking tray with salt and pepper.
steps.content: Put your tilapia on a lined baking tray with salt and pepper. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil so the fish doesn’t stick to the bottom. Spread your filets evenly across the pan so they have about 1 inch (2.5 cm) between them. Sprinkle a pinch of salt and pepper on top of each filet. [20] X Research source If you don’t line your baking tray, spread a non-stick cooking spray on the bottom to prevent the fish from sticking.

steps.title: Spread the mayonnaise mixture over the filets.
steps.content: Spread the mayonnaise mixture over the filets. Use a spoon or a rubber spatula to scoop equal amounts of the mayonnaise mixture onto each of your filets. Spread the mayonnaise so it completely covers the tops of the filets. [21] X Research source You can use as much or as little mayonnaise mixture as you want.

steps.title: Broil the fish for about 8 minutes until it flakes easily.
steps.content: Broil the fish for about 8 minutes until it flakes easily. Set the baking tray on the center rack of your oven and let it cook uncovered. After 8 minutes, check the internal temperature with a meat thermometer to make sure it’s over 145 °F (63 °C). Take the fish out of the oven once it reaches temperature and when the meat is white and flaky. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Serve the tilapia with fresh lemon wedges.
steps.content: Serve the tilapia with fresh lemon wedges. Transfer the fish while it’s still hot onto a warm serving plate so it’s ready to eat. Provide a wedge of fresh lemon with each filet so you can squeeze some of the juice on top of the fish if you want. [23] X Research source Store leftovers in the fridge for up to 4 days or in the freezer for 3 months.

steps.title: Preheat your oven to 400 °F (204 °C).
steps.content: Preheat your oven to 400 °F (204 °C). Move one of the oven racks into the center position so your fish can cook thoroughly. Turn the oven onto 400 °F (204 °C) and let it preheat completely or else the fish won’t have an even cook. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse your tilapia and pat it dry.
steps.content: Rinse your tilapia and pat it dry. Hold your fish under clean running water to rinse out any residual blood or waste inside of it. Rub the meat while you’re cleaning it to clean it completely. Once you’re finished rinsing it, use paper towels to pat the fish dry again. [25] X Research source You can buy whole fresh tilapia from the seafood section of your local supermarket. You may also be able to get whole tilapia frozen.

steps.title: Brush the fish’s skin with olive oil.
steps.content: Brush the fish’s skin with olive oil. Dip the bristles of a kitchen brush into 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of olive oil and lightly coat the outside of the fish. Make sure to brush the entire fish with the oil so flavors can infuse easier and so it doesn’t stick to the baking pan. [26] X Research source You can use any type of vegetable oil for your fish if you don’t have olive oil. Hold the fish over your baking pan while you brush on the oil so you don’t spill it.

steps.title: Place the fish in a baking tray with sliced lemons and red onions.
steps.content: Place the fish in a baking tray with sliced lemons and red onions. Lay the fish flat on its side on the baking pan. If you’re making multiple fish, then leave about 1–2 inches (2.5–5.1 cm) between them so you have space to add aromatics. Fill in the space around the fish with sliced lemons and red onion so they can cook down and infuse flavors into the meat. [27] X Research source You don’t need to use lemon and onion if you don’t want to, but it can add a lot of flavor to the dish.

steps.title: Stuff the inside of the fish with onions, lemon, cilantro, and garlic.
steps.content: Stuff the inside of the fish with onions, lemon, cilantro, and garlic. Lift open the bottom of your tilapia so you can stuff aromatics inside it. Put 5-6 onion slices, 2 slices of fresh lemon, 1 ½ tablespoon (1.5 g) of fresh cilantro, and a clove of fresh garlic inside each fish. Close the fish so you don’t lose any flavor.. [28] X Research source You can stuff the fish with whatever herbs and spices you want. Try oregano, thyme, or dill for additional flavors.

steps.title: Bake the fish uncovered for 15-20 minutes.
steps.content: Bake the fish uncovered for 15-20 minutes. Put the baking pan in your oven on the center rack, and leave it alone for at least 15 minutes. Check the internal temperature of the fish with a meat thermometer to make sure it’s at or above 145 °F (63 °C), or else it’s not safe to eat. Remove the fish from the oven once it’s done cooking and the meat flakes apart easily. [29] X Research source The cooking time for each fish will vary depending on its size and thickness.

steps.title: Serve the tilapia whole while it’s still hot.
steps.content: Serve the tilapia whole while it’s still hot. Transfer one of the tilapia along with some of the cooked onions onto a serving plate with a fresh wedge of lemon. You can eat the skin and the meat of the tilapia. [30] X Research source Keep leftovers in the fridge for up to 4 days and in the freezer for up to 3 months.
